verses.verse: Then Elihu<WH453> continued<WH6030> and said,<WH559>
"Hear<WH8085> my words,<WH4405> you wise<WH2450> men,<WH2450> And listen<WH238> to me, you who know.<WH3045>
"For the ear<WH241> tests<WH974> words,<WH4405> As the palate<WH2441> tastes<WH2938> food.<WH398>
"Let us choose<WH977> for ourselves what<WH4941> is right;<WH4941> Let us know<WH3045> among<WH996> ourselves what<WH4100> is good.<WH2896>
"For Job<WH347> has said,<WH559> 'I am righteous,<WH6663> But God<WH410> has taken<WH5493> away<WH5493> my right;<WH4941>
Should I lie<WH3576> concerning<WH5921> my right<WH4941>? My wound<WH2671> is incurable,<WH605> [though I am] without<WH1097> transgression.<WH6588>'
"What<WH4310> man<WH1397> is like Job,<WH347> Who<WH4310> drinks<WH8354> up derision<WH3933> like water,<WH4325>
Who goes<WH732> in company<WH2274> with the workers<WH6466> of iniquity,<WH205> And walks<WH1980> with wicked<WH7562> men<WH376>?
"For he has said,<WH559> 'It profits<WH5532> a man<WH1397> nothing<WH3808> When he is pleased<WH7521> with God.<WH430>'
"Therefore,<WH3651> listen<WH8085> to me, you men<WH376> of understanding.<WH3824> Far<WH2486> be it from God<WH410> to do wickedness,<WH7562> And from the Almighty<WH7706> to do wrong.<WH5766>
"For He pays<WH9608> a man<WH120> according to his work,<WH6467> And makes him find<WH4672> it according to his way.<WH734>
"Surely,<WH637> <WH551> God<WH410> will not act<WH7561> wickedly,<WH7561> And the Almighty<WH7706> will not pervert<WH5791> justice.<WH4941>
"Who<WH4310> gave<WH6485> Him authority<WH6845> over<WH5921> the earth<WH776>? And who<WH4310> has laid<WH7760> [on Him] the whole<WH3605> world<WH8398>?
"If<WH518> He should determine<WH7760> <WH3820> to do so, If He should gather<WH622> to Himself His spirit<WH7307> and His breath,<WH5397>
All<WH3605> flesh<WH1320> would perish<WH1478> together,<WH3162> And man<WH120> would return<WH7725> to dust.<WH6083>
"But if<WH518> [you have] understanding,<WH998> hear<WH8085> this;<WH384> Listen<WH238> to the sound<WH6963> of my words.<WH4405>
"Shall one who hates<WH8130> justice<WH4941> rule<WH2280>? And will you condemn<WH7561> a righteous<WH6662> mighty<WH3524> one,<WH3524>
Who says<WH559> to a king,<WH4428> 'Worthless<WH1100> one,<WH1100>' To nobles,<WH5081> 'Wicked<WH7563> ones<WH7563>';

Who<WH834> shows<WH5375> no<WH3808> partiality<WH5375> <WH6440> to princes,<WH8269> Nor<WH3808> regards<WH5234> the rich<WH7771> above<WH6440> the poor,<WH1800> For they all<WH3605> are the work<WH4639> of His hands<WH3027>?

"In a moment<WH7281> they die,<WH4191> and at midnight<WH2676> <WH3915> People<WH5971> are shaken<WH1607> and pass<WH5674> away,<WH5674> And the mighty<WH47> are taken<WH5493> away<WH5493> without<WH3808> a hand.<WH3027>
"For His eyes<WH5869> are upon the ways<WH1870> of a man,<WH376> And He sees<WH7200> all<WH3605> his steps.<WH6806>
"There<WH369> is no<WH369> darkness<WH2822> or deep<WH6757> shadow<WH6757> Where<WH8033> the workers<WH6466> of iniquity<WH205> may hide<WH5641> themselves.
"For He does not [need to] consider<WH7760> a man<WH376> further,<WH5750> That he should go<WH1980> before<WH413> God<WH410> in judgment.<WH4941>
"He breaks<WH9570> in pieces mighty<WH3524> men<WH3524> without<WH3808> inquiry,<WH2714> And sets<WH5975> others<WH312> in their place.<WH8478>
"Therefore<WH3651> He knows<WH5234> their works,<WH4566> And He overthrows<WH2015> [them] in the night,<WH3915> And they are crushed.<WH1792>
"He strikes<WH5606> them like<WH8478> the wicked<WH7563> In a public<WH7200> place,<WH4725>
Because<WH834> <WH5921> <WH3651> they turned<WH5493> aside<WH5493> from following<WH310> Him, And had<WH7919> no<WH3808> regard<WH7919> for any<WH3605> of His ways;<WH1870>
So that they caused the cry<WH6818> of the poor<WH1800> to come<WH935> to Him, And that He might hear<WH8085> the cry<WH6818> of the afflicted<WH6041> –

When He keeps<WH8252> quiet,<WH8252> who<WH4310> then can condemn<WH7561>? And when He hides<WH5641> His face,<WH6440> who<WH4310> then can behold<WH7789> Him, That is, in regard<WH5921> to both<WH3162> nation<WH1471> and man<WH120>? –
So<WH4480> that godless<WH2611> men<WH120> should not rule,<WH4427> Nor<WH4480> be snares<WH4170> of the people.<WH5971>
"For has anyone said<WH559> to God,<WH410> 'I have borne<WH5375> [chastisement;] I will not offend<WH2254> [anymore;]
Teach<WH3384> Thou me what I do not see;<WH2372> If<WH518> I have done<WH6466> iniquity,<WH5766> I will do<WH3254> it no<WH3808> more<WH3254>'?
"Shall He recompense<WH9608> on your terms,<WH5973> because<WH3588> you have rejected<WH3988> [it?] For you must choose,<WH977> and not I; Therefore declare<WH1696> what<WH4100> you know.<WH3045>
"Men<WH376> of understanding<WH3824> will say<WH559> to me, And a wise<WH2450> man<WH1397> who hears<WH8085> me,
'Job<WH347> speaks<WH1696> without<WH3808> knowledge,<WH1847> And his words<WH1697> are without<WH3808> wisdom.<WH7919>
'Job<WH347> ought<WH9049> to be tried<WH974> to the limit,<WH5331> Because<WH5921> he answers<WH8666> like wicked<WH205> men.<WH376>
'For he adds<WH3254> rebellion<WH6588> to his sin;<WH9128> He claps<WH5606> his hands among<WH996> us, And multiplies<WH7235> his words<WH561> against God.<WH410>' "
